about.title: About WhereHoops
about.intro: From basketball lovers, for basketball lovers. WhereHoops is a community-driven platform that helps you discover basketball courts near you and connect with fellow hoopers in your area.
about.findCourtsDesc: Discover basketball hoops in your neighborhood with our interactive map. See court conditions, photos, and details before you go.
about.letOthersKnowDesc: Heading to a court? Let other hoopers know you'll be there. Find pickup games and never shoot alone again.
about.connectHoopersDesc: Meet new basketball buddies in your area. Build your local hooping community and find regular playing partners.
about.tipText: Enable location services for the best experience. This helps us show you the nearest courts and calculate distances accurately.

privacy.title: Privacy & Data Policy
privacy.intro: We take your privacy seriously. This page explains what data we collect, how we use it, and the choices you have about your information.
privacy.whatWeCollectText: When you add a basketball court, we collect the details you submit including photos, description, location coordinates, and court condition. We also store metadata such as the submission date. If you enable location services, we temporarily access your location to show nearby courts and calculate distances â€” this data is not stored on our servers.
privacy.howWeUseText: Court information you submit is visible to all users to help the community find places to play. We may use aggregated, anonymized data to improve the service and understand usage patterns. We do not sell your personal information to third parties.
privacy.imagesLicensingText: By uploading photos of basketball courts, you confirm you have the right to share them. Images are displayed publicly on the site to help other users identify courts. If you need an image removed, contact us and we will handle your request promptly.
privacy.locationDataText: WhereHoops uses your device location (with your permission) to show nearby courts and calculate distances. This location data is processed locally in your browser and is not stored on our servers. You can disable location access at any time through your browser settings.
privacy.dataRetentionText: You can request deletion of any court data you've submitted by contacting us. Requests are processed within a reasonable timeframe. Some aggregated statistics may remain in anonymized form.

faq.title: How to Use WhereHoops
faq.intro: Find answers to common questions about using WhereHoops.

readyToPlay.question: How do I let others know I'm going to play?
readyToPlay.answer: On any court card (on the home page or courts list), tap the green "Ready to play" button. This signals to other users that you're heading to that court, helping you find pickup games and connect with fellow hoopers.

addCourt.question: How do I add a new basketball court?
addCourt.answer: Tap "Add Hoop" in the navigation. Fill in the court name, tap the map to set the location (or use your current location), add a description, select the condition and court type (indoor/outdoor), and upload at least one photo. The star icon lets you choose which photo appears as the main profile image.

takePhoto.question: How do I take a good court photo?
takePhoto.answer: For the best results: 1) Include the hoop and backboard clearly in the shot. 2) Show the court surface so others can see the condition. 3) Take photos during daylight for better visibility. 4) Capture any unique features like lighting, benches, or multiple hoops. 5) Avoid photos with people's faces for privacy.

faq.conditionTitle: How do I rate a court's condition?
faq.conditionIntro: When adding a court, select the condition that best matches what you see:

excellent.title: Excellent
excellent.description: Like new or recently renovated. Smooth, crack-free surface. Net in perfect condition. Clear court markings. Well-maintained backboard and rim.

good.title: Good
good.description: Well-maintained with minor wear. Surface has minimal cracks or rough spots. Net may have slight wear but works fine. Court markings visible. Backboard and rim fully functional.

fair.title: Fair
fair.description: Playable but showing age. Some cracks or uneven spots on the surface. Net may be worn or missing. Faded court markings. Equipment works but could use maintenance.

poor.title: Poor
poor.description: Needs significant repairs. Major cracks, holes, or debris on surface. Net missing or badly damaged. No visible markings. Bent rim or damaged backboard. Still playable but with caution.
